info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 15 at 9:59AM PST until January 15 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, highly variable visibility, with less than one quarter mile visibility in dense fog in some locations. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, a period of stagnant air with light winds is expected. * WHERE...In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area and I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County. In Oregon, South Willamette Valley, Central Willamette Valley, Greater Portland Metro Area and Lower Columbia. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until noon PST today. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and highly variable visibility over very short distances. Air stagnation could result in the development and persistence of poor air quality.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use low beam headlights, and leave plenty of following distance ahead of you. Expect rapid changes in visibility from nearly unlimited to less than a quarter mile over very short distances. People with respiratory illness should follow their physician`s advice for dealing with high levels of air pollution during periods of stagnant air. State air quality agencies highly recommend that no outdoor burning occur and that residential wood burning devices be limited as much as possible. According to state air quality agencies, prolonged periods of stagnant air can hold pollutants close to the ground where people live and breathe. Check with your local burn agency for any current restrictions in your area.
